definition: to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head

sentences.english: He uttered the word indifferently, and as though his mind were on something else.
sentences.chinese: 他随口说了这句话，仿佛他还在想着旁的事。

sentences.english: I didn't know who Henry Kissinger was, and I might have asked.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道基辛格是何许人，兴许随口问了。

sentences.english: Talking about markets. I flubbed the line.
sentences.chinese: 谈到市场的时候，我随口说出了那句话。

sentences.english: I riffed up an excuse as to why I didn't show up.
sentences.chinese: 我随口编造了一个理由来解释我为什么没露面。
茱莉亚随口说了一句，紧接着又补上一句，“抱歉。”

sentences.english: Small talk: work and the weather
sentences.chinese: 我们随口聊着，工作和天气。

sentences.english: She was very upset at what to him was just a throwaway remark.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说这只是随口说说而已，她却很生气。

sentences.english: He trotted out an excuse for being late.
sentences.chinese: 他随口编了一个迟到的借口。

sentences.english: Wei Gong opened the chatterbox, casually about their research on Feng shui.
sentences.chinese: 魏公便打开了话匣子，随口讲起自己对风水的研究。

sentences.english: But her natural politeness could not hide the distress in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 但是这些随口而出的客气话未能掩饰她话语中的不安。

sentences.english: That tone has no a sincerity, obviously is freely a lift just.
sentences.chinese: 那语气毫无诚意，显然是随口一提罢了。

sentences.english: You can tell a lot about people by the casual remarks they make.
sentences.chinese: 通过人们随口之言就能从中了解许多。

sentences.english: He tells Bellick he was coming from Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 他随口回答，他是从芝加哥过来的。

sentences.english: The staff dropped a suggestion to the manager.
sentences.chinese: 这位职员向经理随口提了一条建议。

sentences.english: When he speaks, it is often to blurt out some phrase that hasno apparent relevance.
sentences.chinese: 当他说话的时候，通常是随口说的几个不相关的词组。

definition: to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
